metadata.name: Green Awe
metadata.description:
Green version
*
Finding myself, again, in awe of movement. My body begs to learn presence, to release the internal butterflies, to find peace through extremities of your own physicality. 

I never liked when my body felt like a butterfly. 
So I killed the butterflies. All of them. At least I thought. 

The many forms of movement vary by perspective. And to question perspective is, well, to question the mere meaning of a body in space. For, what can ‘movement’ mean, if we’re bound to the earth like the butterflies to my stomach. 

Does my movement require respite?
Or will the butterflies take over again?

Lost in movement, I’ll forget it all — my own thoughts six feet behind form. 
*
